Jira: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49867

I added more conditional logic on line 97 to prevent cases where the instructor clicks inside the ckeditor but doesn't type anything and clicks out of the popover. Some cases were counting these as differences such that the 'draft' alert would display.

On line 108 I introduced a requestUpdate call because the word balloon icon would not update to 'active' after a comment is added (and before dismissing or continuing on with grading in the rubric modal). Inserting it within this block as opposed to after the hideToolTip call doesn't seem to cause any noticeable issues, so I kept it within the block so as not to store block's conditional as a variable (to refer to it below hideToolTip and invoke requestUpdate).

Did some brief testing on this today to see if I could find where 320af93 would be removed.

But got an error when clicking on a student in a site created from a sample roster

`Unexpected RuntimeException: Last cause: Could not find child with id: categoriesList in the wicket:enclosure`

This is from 
`        at org.sakaiproject.gradebookng.tool.panels.GradeSummaryTablePanel.onBeforeRender(GradeSummaryTablePanel.java:90) ~[classes/:?]`

Have you seen this before? I can see the categoryList there but not sure why this is broken.
I have not seen the GradeSummaryTablePanel error yet. Are you testing as a student?

No, I was testing as an instructor when clicking on a student in the list.

Was testing in a older course that had previously been created with a sample Academic Term and roster: SMPL 101 Spring 2023. 

Was doing this as instructor/sakai.

Then going to the gradebook and clicking on any student in the list resulted in this error. 

I also created a new site, added a student (student0001) and clicking on that student has this error. 

This was the fuller stacktrace. I tried removing the child id which gives another error. I'm not sure how the `<wicket enclosure child="">` tag is supposed to work. 
```
21-Apr-2024 17:42:49.924 ERROR [http-nio-8080-exec-10] o.a.w.DefaultExceptionMapper.mapUnexpectedExceptions Unexpected error occurred
org.apache.wicket.WicketRuntimeException: Could not find child with id: categoriesList in the wicket:enclosure
        at org.apache.wicket.markup.html.internal.Enclosure.checkChildComponent(Enclosure.java:295) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.markup.html.internal.Enclosure.getChildComponent(Enclosure.java:273) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.markup.html.internal.Enclosure.getChild(Enclosure.java:136) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.markup.html.internal.Enclosure.onConfigure(Enclosure.java:178) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.Component.configure(Component.java:996) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.Component.beforeRender(Component.java:938) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.MarkupContainer.onBeforeRenderChildren(MarkupContainer.java:1759) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.apache.wicket.Component.onBeforeRender(Component.java:3832) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
        at org.sakaiproject.gradebookng.tool.panels.GradeSummaryTablePanel.onBeforeRender(GradeSummaryTablePanel.java:90) ~[classes/:?]
        at org.apache.wicket.Component.beforeRender(Component.java:949) ~[wicket-core-9.17.0.jar:9.17.0]
```

On current nightly, this pops up a "Grade Summary" panel with the two tabs.

Thanks, I can replicate. I'm also stumped.

`<wicket:enclosure child="id">` seems to be a way of tying visibility to the visibility of the child .... just seems to be a shortcut to make code simpler.
The good news is that with that change the tabs look about the same as in prod.

Wow Matt how did you think of that! Nice.

On Sun, Apr 21, 2024 at 6:37 PM Code Hugger (Matthew Jones) <
***@***.***> wrote:

> The good news is that with that change the tabs look about the same as in
> prod but there's a few other styling issues that could probably be slightly
> improved.
>
> —
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub
> <https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/12513#issuecomment-2068230902>,
> or unsubscribe
> <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AAGF4COT3SK7BPC34POAFT3Y6Q5TXAVCNFSM6AAAAABGFCVJH6VHI2DSMVQWIX3LMV43OSLTON2WKQ3PNVWWK3TUHMZDANRYGIZTAOJQGI>
> .
> You are receiving this because you authored the thread.Message ID:
> ***@***.***>
>

I tried to ask GPT but it couldn't figure out what was wrong. It did suggest to ensure the component exists in Java and it wasn't being removed. I also asked if it matters if I call the super method at the end of the beginning and it said:

> * Calling super.method() at the beginning: This is useful when you want the behavior of the superclass method to execute first, followed by additional functionality specific to the subclass. This approach ensures that the superclass behavior is preserved and then extended upon.

> * Calling super.method() at the end: Conversely, placing the call to super.method() at the end allows the subclass to execute its functionality first, followed by the behavior of the superclass method. This is helpful when you want to ensure that the subclass's behavior takes precedence over that of the superclass.

So based on the stack trace it just seemed like it was needing to run here after everything else was done and I just tried it out. This seemed easier than a larger refactor. I'm not sure the behavior difference. I was looking through the code for Enclosure and I think this might have been it where there was actually a bug in wicket versions before 7 where the configure method wasn't called, and now when it was called early it didn't work. 

https://github.com/apache/wicket/commit/c97e3f4b0e7c7300c41d4608547d8bd16f37498f

Possibly doing some splitting and having some of this in the `onInitialize` would also work but I've tested this out and didn't see any problems. 

There's also an error thrown if you don't call the `super.onBeforeRender()` at all, but as long as you call it it's all good. I don't see any advice on where/when to call it but it does seems to make a difference.

body:
There have been test failures where the truncation of the timestamp resulted in a different day than the begin time of the presence. This is because the truncation of an Instant is UTC based and in some tests a Presence record is inserted into the test db with a Date that is based on an Instant that has not been truncated. Truncating the Instants in the tests would have solved this failures as well, but to keep the behavior consistent with the previous code and other stats I changed my code to use the system timezone - not UTC - for the date truncation of the presence times.

https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47101

Seems like Wicket still supports Tree? My guess it's just one day to figure out.

These were on https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/issues/SAK-33238

From Wicket 7 on they dropped these tree classes and just have the new AbstractTree that has a NestedTree and TableTree.

> The old Tree component in wicket-extensions is removed.
> It was based on Swing APIs and many people complained about this. Use the new Tree component introduced in Wicket 6.0.0 instead.

I believe that TreeTable needed to be converted to one of these. I'm not sure what LinkTree would migrate to maybe NestedTree. It also needed to implement TreeModelProvider. 

I worked on it in 2017 and didn't finish it and didn't get it to work both because I didn't know how Delegated Access fully worked (especially features like the shopping cart) and I also didn't know Wicket enough. I'd have liked to develop a Wicket tool from scratch.

This merges the scorm contrib tool's latest version into Sakai while maintaining commit history. Additionally, I've included the "scormplayer" module in the base pom, updated the pom versions to 25-SNAPSHOT, and fixed tests.

Other local to UD work we could contribute after this is merged:
1. Import/duplicate scorm content
2. Link to scorm package in lessons, including making it required/pre-req.
3. "Upload new version" feature in the tool (this has some limitations but allows for simple typo fixing, etc.)

Locally: build and deploy successful, tests pass, startup is clean in fresh Sakai instance, basic tool testing works as expected.

body:
Jira: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49894

The intent of this PR is to share how to fix the specific bug described in the test plan of SAK-49894, the core problem being in AssignmentEntityProvider. The approach I took was to add a new parameter “mergeOverride” that the Grader code could explicitly invoke to solve this issue without breaking some other scenario (which I don’t know if such exists, but erring on the side of caution I thought it might).

Furthermore, the introduction of ‘mergeOverride’ exposed another bug where the “grade” value that would be returned is not formatted for displaying to users. I remove this logic (lines 682-685), given that it seems redundant based on the if-else conditional immediately preceding it (unless there’s something subtle here that I’m missing).

Given my aforementioned caution regarding scenarios to preserve (i.e., where ‘mergeOverride’ should indeed remain ‘true’), I assume that adding a unit test regarding this and other cases would be warranted. I did not attempt that here but others are more than welcome to push a commit here that would take care of that.

Finally, I made two fixes here to Grader’s text field. The “id” attribution should be conditional, displaying only for the Grade field, and not also for the grade override fields. Also, I repaired the “class” attribute such that the value of “points-input” will actually render in the DOM for the Grade field. This is important for decreasing that field’s width; otherwise, for peer evaluations, the info popover icon is forced to a new line/row.

As I said in the jira, we don't have a preference but hiding it via property would be the less agressive and more usual solution for similar cases

This code has been the source of many bugs in the past and in the present. We support way too many paths and way too many ways to do things. 

I have no idea who thought of the feature and am not assigning blame. It's just a bad feature, bad implementation, bad code. Let's move on and focus on fixing bugs.
LGTM I didn't see any other pieces to remove

comments:
@csev Looks like if you drop `EMAIL` from the index it would also work without any changes as that's 500 characters. I'm not sure what this is used for any why `SAKAI_USER_ID `and `EMAIL `are both needed and would be different. 

As now it's
`SUBJECT`=500
`TENANT_GUID`=36
`SAKAI_USER_ID`=99
`EMAIL`=500
(500+36+9+500)*4 = 4180, slightly over with 3 bytes and quite over with 4. 

`SAKAI_USER` has email at 255 which is a good change but does it even need to be here? Lowering that to 255 makes the index max at 3200, so it's still a little over, but the `SUBJECT` reduction also here would do it if that's a good size.

Here is one composite key you need:
```
 51     Predicate cond = cb.and(
 52         cb.equal(root.get("subject"), subject),
 53         cb.equal(root.get("tenant"), tenant)
 54     );
```

Here is a different composite key you need:

```
 71     Predicate cond = cb.and(
 72         cb.equal(root.get("email"), email),
 73         cb.equal(root.get("tenant"), tenant)
 74     );
 75
```

Here is another composite key you need:

```
 98     Predicate cond = cb.and(
 99         cb.equal(root.get("sakaiUserId"), sakaiUserId),
100         cb.equal(root.get("tenant"), tenant)
101     );
```

**I have modified the PR to match these queries**

So by changing these indexes, the change to the size of `SUBJECT` isn't _necessarily_ needed anymore. I think that was the only question that @csev had on the call. 

(Old) SUBJECT + TENANT = 500+36= 536
EMAIL + TENANT = 255+36= 291
USERID + TENANT = 99+36=135

Those are all well within the limits.
Yes, but the new sizes are more accurate. No need for 500 chars here

body:
Hi @bgarciaentornos, I spent a bunch of hours in here. It's really difficult code.

This reverts a lot of the code in SAK-48067 from Vincent. I tested paging, and it works with this code.

This also reverts some code from the Dynamic Rubrics: S2U-5 5.1.1.1 Tests & Quizzes: Dynamic Rubrics - MASTER (#12241)

My main question: is the Dynamic Rubrics code very important? It scares me because I don't understand it. And it seems to touch lots of code. Will it be maintained going forward?

Note that I also revert a bit of code from Fernando in SAK-47090 Test & Quizzes - Set a bigger number of students in Sakai Pager and set it as default selected value (#10374). I don't think that code had much of an effect as the number gets overridden via the setter.
comments:
Hi, Sam, thanks for taking a look into this.

Dynamic rubrics is an important piece, part of the Unidigital project and it was also added very recently so it's not only alive, it's a newborn! From what I see the only "revert" you do is getting rid of the boolean param, but I'm not 100% sure why? Does it fail with it? We can test an alternative proposed solution but just removing that bit is not ideal.

I also added Jesus as a reviewer as he might know more about Fernando's changes.

> From what I see the only "revert" you do is getting rid of the boolean param, but I'm not 100% sure why? Does it fail with it? We can test an alternative proposed solution but just removing that bit is not ideal.

Thanks for taking a look. getAllAgents() is only called once in this new PR code. So there is no real need for the boolean param. I don't know how to test Dynamics Rubrics. Can you have someone test it or let me know how to test it?

Thing is the questionScores method inside getAllAgents uses that param too and it was the main reason for that override. It was introduced for a specific case within the dynamic rubrics, not sure what would happen now with your change. Let me think about it and I'll come back to you, hopefully we can find a middle point that supports it all. We can do the testing related to S2U-5 ourselves but hopefully we can find a way of solving this without breaking that feature. (We can do a demo of sorts at some point in the future, but I guess it's not worth it for you to delve deeper into it right now.)

Also on 22.x you won't find that param, so it might be one of those "different PR for each version" situations while we're discussing this...
Hi @bgarciaentornos did you have a chance to test this against dynamic rubrics?

Sorry, I was bloated with other tasks and also we had a big local holiday. I have a modification in mind that might avoid regressions while respecting your changes. Hopefully I can work on it and test it today and come back to you asap.

EDIT: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49669 is still open, so that might unfortunately delay the testing a bit
I have just added a commit but please wait until I can verify the functionality in a Linux env. Thanks!
Thanks! Note that if you push your commit to this branch, it will spin up a Linux server in Github Actions that is available via a Cloudflare tunnel for quick testing ;)
ok cool, this is working for me locally. good to merge?

> Thanks! Note that if you push your commit to this branch, it will spin up a Linux server in Github Actions that is available via a Cloudflare tunnel for quick testing ;)

Hi! I can't see the Github Actions/Cloudfare, is it because permissions or am I missing something? Thanks!
I was going to verify this, but I found something else in the S2U-5 that is broken and is preventing me from testing this part. Let me find when did that happen and if I can fix it quickly.

It was broken here -> https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/12329
I think I can do a temp local fix to verify this and will fix it better whenever I have more time

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49755

The tutorial will now appear only for first-time users, like 22.x and before that.

Removed local storage use; tutorial progress is now temporarily saved in session storage under specific conditions (manual initiation by the user and navigation away from /portal).

The reason we need to store whether the tutorial is running or not, 

The tutorial is designed to work exclusively on the /portal page due to its unique setup. once the code reloads the tutorial needs to know if it should start.

Upon completion or dismissal, the tutorial's data is cleared from session storage.

Thanks.

body:
Some ideas for review.

I'm going to leave this as draft for now and am happy if someone does this differently or if this is almost good and I can fix it up.

Some things I didn't like:

I don't think these dropdowns should appear on the overview (iframe) divs but I don't see a better way to detect this other than `$pageColumnLayout == 'col1'`

I'm also not sure why some of these negative margins were in there and they made the link no longer appear. 

I'm not sure if there's any other edge cases here or if there's a better place this dropdown could be placed.

Before switching
![image](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/27447/5efd94cc-92ee-416c-9ae4-0b723e7f0e46)
In view student mode
![image](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/27447/f3ba0402-63d4-4dc6-a462-bdd4af8cf003)
comments: I probably should look at that `viewAsStudentLink` variable in the backend to avoid the frontend check.

> I don't think these dropdowns should appear on the overview (iframe) divs but I don't see a better way to detect this other than `$pageColumnLayout == 'col1'`
> 
> I'm also not sure why some of these negative margins were in there and they made the link no longer appear.
> 
> I'm not sure if there's any other edge cases here or if there's a better place this dropdown could be placed.

I said the same thing to myself when I did this PR for the updated portal. I hope someone will tell me if there's a better way to do it :). I like it. This is better than what I did.  Thanks @jonespm

Do you mean, The Overview tool shouldn't have the option for role-swap? 

I think the negative margins were there to align the dropdown. I wasn't happy with it either.

Thanks for the comments, I added your change and also changed it to check for isHomePage rather than the double column which seems more straightforward since this is the page with 99% of the issue. I think it's looking pretty nice now. I checked it also on mobile view and seems pretty nice there too.

![image](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/27447/7cc223b1-450b-4c64-9ca5-03e6c57a8aba)

body:
Creating as a draft, as I guess this is a big piece and will generate debate.

Linking the original s2u-22x PR and copying some of the comments I added in there:

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/12127

Some context about parameter duplication: previously gradebook instances were linked to a site id, so every method and query regarding permissions, objects or whatever could use the same value. Splitting that between site for permissions and group for gb instance was the hardest bit, deciding where would fit one value or the other on each of the dozens of methods and hundreds of calls.

The scope of this development was limited to providing group support to the gradebook tool, but we're already in talks to follow this work for external integrations (assignments, samigo, content-review, webservices, lti...). For that reason we created this different jira:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49493

The comments about using the same parameter twice is to keep those integrations working as before (gradebook site instances), while moving the code closer to the future version. Gradebookng has lots and lots of similar methods receiving different arguments, called from many different places and doing similar things but not always the same. That was hard to read and to maintain, so I tried to leave it ready so whoever gets other pieces of work doesn't have to go through that process again.
comments: Fix for cypress tests -> https://github.com/sakaicontrib/cypress-sakai/pull/4

This work has been carried on under different branches, but final contribution might be done under [SAK-49493](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49493) if it's preferred that way.

As this comes from a request by his university, @jesusmmp has been following closely the development and also @ern has been informed about the progress, so it can be contributed for 25x.

[SAK-49493]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49493?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

I've removed the accordions from the replace screen. They were added as part of the trinity work, but merge wasn't done at the same time. The accordions are clunky in my opinion, so I've removed them. Also, I've added hidden sites to the merge screen - they are currently only on the replace screen for some reason.

body:
Jira: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49700

The proposed fix conforms to the change introduced with Sakai 23, whereby the association between Assignments and GB items created in GB are now based on the GB item's ID instead of the GB item's name/title as before.
comments: @hornersa This is ok to do but you do make sure that it is backwards compatible so it should still work with existing associations.

This PR does not attempt any backwards compatibility. I reported the broader backwards compatibility issue for ASN-GB associations last July, with the following Critical priority jira: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49097. 

After not seeing any response to that jira for a few months, I wrote a PHP script for local use to run after the SQL update scripts to modify DB records for relevant Assignment properties to accommodate to the new use of GB item ID prevalent in Sakai 23 code. 

Is there backwards compatibility implemented elsewhere in Sakai 23/24 for these ASN-GB associations that I may have missed?
@hornersa I converted this to a draft while there is further discussion.
@hornersa  I don't think this PR can be accepted as is. A conversion SQL script would be needed. otherwise it needs to be compatible with both String and Long linkIds.

@ern - To expedite a solution to this jira while also managing the related issues pertaining to backwards compatibility, SQL script updates, etc., I think it might to close this PR and let someone else take over this solution's development. The above is not something I can commit to at the moment. I'll proceed to remove myself as Assignee to the jira.

Thanks for your work @hornersa 

Adding bugs and regressions is a part of the lifecycle of a product, but I think it's a bit worrying that some attempts to fix regressions are blocked and left on hold with nobody jumping in to fix them, see also https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/11682

body:
… used 'Save' as opposed to 'Save and Release to Student'

Assignment extensions should not require that the Instructor to 'Return' the assignment to the student, selecting 'Save' should be sufficient. Currently it is required to use 'Save and Release to Student'.

This pull request provides the ability to create an 'Exception' as an accommodation similar to the capability in Tests & Quizzes using 'Save'.
This allows the student to see the extension date without the potentially confusing status of 'Returned' and to see the extension date as soon as the instructor creates the extension, be that before or after the assignment's normal due date.

body:
Jira [SAK-49339](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49339)

T&Q (with 1 exam) and Lessons (with the exam attached) is imported to a second Site.
There, instructor publishes the exam to make it available on Lessons.
When Lessons is accessed for the first time, a new access group has to be created to manage the exam item (as it has prerequisite options).

The issue comes when the first user is a student, as it won't have the permissions for this action to be performed.
So we're making an exception for this case.


Relocated `siteUpdAdvisor` as a global variable, to reuse the SecurityAdvisor.


[SAK-49339]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49339?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

comments:
are you replacing momentjs? i don't love having another date-manipulation library just for this one function. moment seems to do what you're looking to do:

`moment().startOf('hour').fromNow();   `
Moment is deprecated, and heavy. I'm only replacing it for tasks. I was using moment here, just to humanize the durations.

> Moment is deprecated, and heavy. I'm only replacing it for tasks. I was using moment here, just to humanize the durations.

the manual locale loading is 🤷
Tree shaking ... Why load all moment's locales? It bloats your bundles. Good point though - I hate it too

> Tree shaking ... Why load all moment's locales? It bloats your bundles. Good point though - I hate it too

because we are a big multi-locale app that supports you switching locales

@ottenhoff I know, but these locales are only loaded in this one module, and the module only brings in the functions it needs from date-fns. It's a lot more compact, and supported. It does mean we have to sync up that module as we add more locales - that might be an issue?
i guess it would be annoying if we were adding lots of locales, but we aren't so, maybe not a big deal. it's not fun from maintainability perspective, but hey ....
Moment is dead though. So we need to move to something at some point. We can do a lot of what moment does in vanilla JS, nowadays, but that humanize stuff is really nice and not in vanilla.

I've added all our locales to the module, and tested each of them in the tasks widget. Just to be clear, this PR will only move tasks to using date-fns. Moment will still be used elsewhere, same as now.
okay, right on ... let's move forward
@ottenhoff Go on, mash that approve button.

body:
Jira: [SAK-49294](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49294)

> In Lessons, the student can't access the group assignment (to which he belongs) despite having completed the prerequisite

An assignment with assigned group(s) will be managed through a single ACCESS group on Lessons.
To access the assignment after completing the prerequisite, the user should be automatically added to the ACCESS group - if it's present on the original group(s).

To allow this behavior to work, membership won't be locked for ACCESS groups ✅ 
___
Also within this commit, the locks won't be removed for the initial group after being 'replaced' by the ACCESS one.
As they can prevent inconsistent behaviors.

![BA_GroupList](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/81161239/59722969-c442-496c-8b6a-724687bc17d0)
_img B/A this fix - result of setting "Don't release item until all prerequisites are completed"_

[SAK-49294]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49294?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

body:
Some context about parameter duplication: previously gradebook instances were linked to a site id, so every method and query regarding permissions, objects or whatever could use the same value. Splitting that between site for permissions and group for gb instance was the hardest bit, deciding where would fit one value or the other on each of the dozens of methods and hundreds of calls.

The scope of this development was limited to providing group support to the gradebook tool, but we realized it would be important to follow this work for external integrations (assignments, samigo, content-review, webservices, lti...). For that reason I created this different jira:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49493

The comments about using the same parameter twice is to keep those integrations working as before (gradebook site instances), while moving the code closer to the future version. Both edu-services and gradebookng has lots and lots of similar methods receiving different arguments, called from many different places and doing similar things but not always the same. That was hard to read and to maintain, so I tried to leave it ready so whoever gets that other piece of work doesn't have to go through that process again.

Thanks for the review, I'll work on the other comments/suggestions next!

Splitting that between site for permissions and group for gb instance was the hardest bit, deciding where would fit one value or the other on each of the dozens of methods and hundreds of calls.

The scope of this development was limited to providing group support to the gradebook tool, but we realized it would be important to follow this work for external integrations (assignments, samigo, content-review, webservices, lti...). For that reason I created this different jira:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49493

The comments about using the same parameter twice is to keep those integrations working as before (gradebok site instances), while moving the code closer to the future version. Both edu-services and gradebookng has lots and lots of similar methods receiving different arguments, called from many different places and doing similar things but not always the same. That was hard to read and to maintain, so I tried to leave it ready so whoever gets that other piece of work doesn't have to go through that process again.

Thanks for the review, I'll work on the other comments/suggestions next!

body:
While investigating several other JIRAs, I did a detailed review and testing of the Plus "first launch" code because I thought those JIRAs were caused by my code.  After all the investigation of those JIRAs it turns out the tutorial was the problem all along so I moved the First launch cleanup to a new JIRA.

But during the review, in hopes of catching whatever error was happening, I strengthened some areas of the first launch code.

Some error messages have been improved, some error messages have been added, some extra checking has been added to catch inconsistencies in new site setup earlier, and the initial roster pull has been moved from a Thread in ProviderServlet to an Executor in the PlusServiceImpl - following the example in RefreshAuthZGroups.

This is the pull request formerly known as SAK-49467 :)

Jira  [SAK-47385](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47385)

This affects published exams that have been imported from another site, and were present on a lessons page that has also been imported. They won't show for students until the instructor views the lessons page.

To fix it:
On the isItemVisible method
Before checking if the assessment is published or not, [getEntity(...)](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/blob/defdc46fdd6597978006ddf446b0bece3a1a2c4a/lessonbuilder/tool/src/java/org/sakaiproject/lessonbuildertool/service/SamigoEntity.java#L293) will update the assessment id from "sam_core/x" to "sam_pub/x" if it is present on SAM_PUBLISHEDASSESSMENT_T table (published on samigo).


[SAK-47385]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47385?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47315

This is the dirtiest of hacks and I am not proud of it. But ... until I work out a decent way of not annoying lit by moving stuff around underneath it, it will do the job.
comments:
I see that you are not happy with this hack and I don't want to block this fix for the release, if this is going to be addressed later. Anyway, I see two alternatives to this fix that might be unnoticed by the user:
1. Update the data that is used to render the criterions by sorting it based on `sortedIds`.
2. Fetch the sorted criterions again from the backend.

I would think lit would just update the dom then, based on the new order and things should work. If the confusion of lit goes deeper though, could you clarify more or less what is happening please?

I tried updating the criteria array based on the sortedIds, then calling this.requestUpdate. But, it didn't work. In the render method you see that the criteria list has been updated with one less after the delete, but the dom is not updated accordingly. It seems that once sortable has moved things around, lit loses awareness of it. The deleted criterion effectively becomes detached.
I'm hoping the keyed diretive in lit 3 will fix this kind of thing - I think that is the intent. Although we can only move to lit 3 when the bundling PR is in.
That's interesting, sounds pretty tricky... Let's hope lit 3 will do the job :)
I'll test it out in the bundling pr
I suggest we merge this horrible hack in the meantime though. I hope the community can forgive me for such a sin.

comments: I've definitely seen this exception before. What's the key fix here? I don't see it.

> I've definitely seen this exception before. What's the key fix here? I don't see it.

Unfortunatelly I don't know the culprit, this repairs the consequence but not the root cause and that's bad because the user report is super confusing :( They don't know how to reproduce it but the forums stopped working in that site, all of them.

The logic to see if has previous or next items is a bit weird and repetitive, the logic to get the previous and next items do the same iterations. There are 4 methods (hasNext, hasPrevious, getNext, getPrevious), one has a try-catch block, the other three don't and this PR adds some try-catch.

The issue is related to how msgcntr works directly with the hibernate entities which can still be in their proxied state.
class org.sakaiproject.component.app.messageforums.dao.hibernate.TopicImpl$HibernateProxy$Ty3yjfw9
cannot be cast to class org.sakaiproject.api.app.messageforums.DiscussionTopic (org.sakaiproject.component.app.messageforums.dao.hibernate.TopicImpl$HibernateProxy$Ty3yjfw9 and org.sakaiproject.api.app.messageforums.DiscussionTopic

The HibernateProxy instances must first be unproxied before it can be cast to the DiscussionTopic. The use of proxies by Hibernate allows for it to be efficient by not fetching the data unless it is actually accessed (using the proxy), this also means there is more than one way to fix this.
Thanks for the explanation @ern, this is hard to reproduce but I still have the data so probably can work on this later today.
Done, I reproduced the issue again and the fix works fine as the other does.

body:
Legacy Sakai databases use utf8mb3 meaning that 4-byte emojis cannot be stored as a native character. New Sakai orgs or orgs that can do a complete conversion should use utf8mb4 instead.

This code uses an emoji library to convert emojis into the HTML entity. 

We should probably consider changing the default in Sakai or doing automatic detection of the database.

comments:
A few comments while investigating this:

1) Original kernel authors seemed to have the *intention* of using GMT for all dates and thus passed a GregorianCalendar(GMT) to several methods

2) MySQL Connector J <= 5.1.46 and several versions of Oracle Connector seemed to ignore this GregorianCalendar!

3) MySQL Connector J >= 5.1.47 and Maria Connector correctly use the GregorianCalendar

4) Hibernate just writes the date in JVM timezone without contortions

5) It's crazy to have ASN_ASSIGNMENT use Eastern timezone and SAKAI_USER to have GMT

6) Most MySQL institutions continue to use 5.1.46 connector to preserve the old (preferred) behavior

7) Announcements serializes dates to base64-encoded XML and will continue to use GMT as modifying base64-encoded XML is a ridiculous task

CC: @davidpbauer, @csev

I added a new commit that continues to use TIMESTAMP type and cleans up UsageSessionService.
The only notable change will be that SESSION_ACTIVE will use false '0' vs a null.

comments: Tasty - I was wondering how we were going to handle this.   Folks say 'no' to the "accept notifications" for all sites - so for an LMS they need a second chance.  We will need to see if browsers kind of beat us up - they probably have some trick to keep sites from asking over and over.
which path names in particular?

I've updated this to change the ROOT sakai maven module to just be called "root" and not "sakai-root". Also, I've added a button in the notifications window to make it explicit that the user is opting into Sakai notifications.
I've now updated this maven module to be called "serviceworker". No more root.

@adrianfish I think I can take a look at the PR sometime next week, if it's still needed. But just to get some context, when the user does not accept the push notifications, there will be no notifications within the portal neither?
@stetsche Exactly that. Our challenge is inform the user that Sakai notifications are good. Push is so powerful and it is a shame that companies have abused it so heavily.

@adrianfish, okay I understand what the PR is for. But when I enable push notifications, will notifications display only in the portal, or like other push notifications as OS notifications (What a lot of websites are abusing)?
Depending on the browser, both. Chrome and firefox will popup a OS notification as well as adding a notification to the portal area.
Okay, and if you want to have only portal notifications you need to enable them in the browser and block browser notifications on the OS level?
I suppose so. Or we could just disable them in the js. They are explicitly triggered, the os notifications.
Done with this now. I've removed sakai-message-broker.js. Most of the logic moved nicely into sakai-push.utils.js and the remainder I just tacked onto portal.init.js.
This seems to consistently break Cypress tests. I saw lots of errors in my console around theme switching. Maybe theme switcher was depending on something that got moved?
Thanks a ton @stetsche, for the review. And anybody else who reviewed this PR. Much appreciated :)
I think the husky command is failing for windows

comments: Dr Chuck there are a number of Base62 encoders in maven central, better to use one of those than rolling your own.

Base62 decoders, neither of these seem to be used much and haven't been updated in awhile. 

- https://github.com/unbroken-dome/base62
- https://github.com/seruco/base62

I saw this more featureful library looks more popular and has more maintenance activity. It has a lot of different Codecs in it so we could use this in other places. https://github.com/f4b6a3/uuid-creator/wiki/4.0.-Library-codecs#base-62-format
- https://github.com/f4b6a3/uuid-creator

@jonespm , the problem with most Base62 encoders is that they are used for "longs" in UUID serialization.   Few actually do string-to-string-back-to-string encoding.  And I do not want to add another dependency to something that receives less open source support than Sakai.  I do not want to repeat the GenericDAO, RSF, reflectutils ... folly.  If you think 15 lines of code in our code base is tech debt, a dependency maintained by a person who has not touched their code in several years - that is real tech debt.

@ern I checked if the java.util.Base-64 url-safe encoding was safe for double encoding - it was not.  I will add a unit test to verify this now and in the future.   I also wrote a unit test to use io.jsonwebtoken.io.Base64 which we both noticed did not add padding and is why JWTs are safe for double URL encoding.  But alas,  the jjwt-api authors fear their fork of Base64 escaping the lab and so made it protected so it is only usable in class-siblings.   I am guessing they did not want anyone mistakenly using it as a generic Base64, being interoperable, and then being later criticised. Methinks they would have been smarter to use Base62 with string method signatures and then making it public so I could have used it :)  I would have loved to be a fly on the while as the jjwt folks debated how to be super safe w.r.t URLs given that there is a Java built in "safe" encoder already and an RFC that perfectly demonstrates something that is "98.4375 percent safe".

I just offered a few packages as Earle had made the suggestion. I'm fine with what's here but I also generally prefer trying to find a maintained library over adding code that one of us mght have to fix a bug in someday. 

This has unit tests and I don't have time to test an alternative so seems fine to me. Thanks!

comments: Followup from the call this might be possible to use this [org.apache.http.message.BasicHeaderValueParser ](https://hc.apache.org/httpcomponents-core-4.4.x/current/httpcore/apidocs/org/apache/http/message/BasicHeaderValueParser.html) library. I also believe that switching to `org.apache.http.client.HttpClient` instead of `java.net.http.HttpClient` and using their `response.getHeaders("Link")` [might also be using this same library](https://github.com/apache/httpcomponents-client/blob/9748d1baf825fa525d9dea37fec266d2bda39cc1/httpclient5/src/main/java/org/apache/hc/client5/http/impl/classic/ContentCompressionExec.java#L161C1-L162C1) and produce an expected response.

So @jonespm - I tried both the 4.x and 5.x `BasicHeaderValueParser` and they are both pretty lame.  Their use case is for headers that look like this:

`param1=value1; param2=value2; param3=value3`

When presented any kind of link header with pretty intricate rules about separators, url encoding, etc, both of these libraries fall flat and get 100% lost and can't even do the basic stuff that Java does until it meets the Canvas variant of the header.

I dove into the code thinking that to avoid the dreaded regex, I would do some ad hoc parsing.   I started to rough it out and figured that a simple regex is a clearer and safer path.  I suggest merging as it.

param1=value1; param2=value2; param3=value3

> I suggest merging as it.

+1
Thanks.

body:
This feels a little bit of a hack but I couldn't figure out how to get this to work with how this page was implemented otherwise.

My idea was to set all of the divs to be tab navigable. And when then the edit button will be displayed. When you navigate to another div it will just clean up all the edit buttons.

The _best_ way might be to redesign this page to not have hidden buttons like this, and I'm not sure why it's implemented this was with the hidden buttons.

The downside of this is that the last edit button will remain if you tab past the last element. And you also can't directly shift-tab to the previous edit button as you'd have to shift-tab then tab again to get to edit. 

If there's a better way someone has to do this go for it, but this at least makes this fully navigable with the keyboard.

Note that for Checklists, the checklist title needs to have a value for the spinner logic to be invoked. Otherwise, the disable and spin invocation would conflict with extant form validation behavior. 
I intentionally avoided using jquery for the corresponding logic within the onclick attribute. Furthermore, I needed to avoid using '&&' for a logical-AND within onclick-- otherwise the RSF template for Checklist.html encounters a syntax error; thus, I used nested if statements to workaround that problem.

I don't think it's a security issue.

Several changes of SAK-48096 patch consist in two lines: the first builds a list of strings in userAuditList variable and the second adds the list with userAuditRegistration.

When these changes are included in changeSiteMemberStatus there are a third line, the one I think is useless.

siteService.getSite(siteid).getUserRole(user.getId()).getId();

User's role is retrieved but it's not used at all. And it throws an NPE when the user is disabled.

My change just remove this line and we have tested that the method still works.

If you are the owner of the public rubric (meaning you have the rubric in both “Site Rubrics” and “Public Rubrics”), attempting to expand the public version of the rubric will expand the “private” version of the rubric because they share the same rubric ID.

If you are not the owner of the public rubric (meaning you only have the rubric in your “Public Rubrics” section), attempting to expand the public rubric will do nothing because you don’t have a corresponding rubric ID in your “Site Rubrics” section.

With this proposed fix, I use b5 classes where possible to fix spacing issues; however, there are some exceptions where extant element selectors allow for new CSS statements in _samigo.sass to resolve issues more efficiently (i.e., without having to modify multiple JSP templates). For the delivery of question types (e.g., for taking or previewing assessments), I also remove line break elements (
) and non-breaking space entities ( ) that have been used for presentation logic. In the [corresponding jira](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49119), I have attached 46 screenshots: 23 screenshots are prefixed with “Issue” to depict UI issues within this jira’s scope. They also include numbers and sometimes letters for easier reference with respect to the General > Description in the jira. The other 23 screenshots are prefixed with “Fix” and the same numbering/lettering scheme. I recommend downloading the attached screenshots to your OS to more easily sort the filenames and compare the “before” (Issue) and “after” (Fix) pics. The code conflict associated with this PR pertains to [fixes for S2U-12 5.1.1.8](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commit/8f7c962aae4a6c528fc1dc03a384ef5194f44282) that were merged into master after I had already branched from master to work on this (SAK-49119) branch. Note that in samigo/samigo-app/src/webapp/jsf/delivery/item/deliverCalculatedQuestion.jsp, the element with id="feedSC" currently has value="#{question.feedbackValue}". While appropriate for 24.x, I assume the value should instead be "#{question.feedback}” if/when merged for 23.x.

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49149

Supplemental to SAK-24423, this will provide a new option within “Manage Access” under the joinable site settings: email notifications when someone elects to join the site, which will be sent to all site maintainers.

**NOTE:** introduces a new sakai.property to enable/disable this feature globally: `sitemanage.join.notification.enabled=[true/false]` (defaults to `false`)
comments:
This code was written way back in 2012. It was originally contrib'd along with the other joinable site settings in SAK-24423, but the join notification email aspect was rejected at that time due to a cyclical dependency. Now that `EmailTemplateService` has been moved into kernel, we're able to stop sitting on this as a local modification.

Despite this code working well and not having issues in 10+ years, we have not gone back to refactor this code at all, and it could very well use some updating. However, we have not been given resources to update this code for contribution.

As for the new `getUserSites` method, I'm also assuming it's needed but I haven't looked into it further than porting the code. Unfortunately I'm still not able to put resources towards modifying this PR, but if someone wants to make edits, feel free to do so.

There also seems to be some support/interest in this feature on the JIRA ticket itself.

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49138

Prior to the move to UnboundID, Sakai had the capability to encrypt (and subsequently decrypt when needed) candidate details through LDAP (for instance student/employee numbers).

This capability was not ported when the move from JLDAP to UnboundID was performed. This is a regression for any institution that was previously using this functionality with JLDAP.

comments:
@adrianfish @ern I think we should avoid merging big changes before
tickets from Unidigital were merged. Please, take in mind. Thanks!

Agree @jesusmmp, things like this ended badly in the past. 

I'm in favor of any improvement that needs to be done, but always planning them with any team working on the same components, to evaluate the changes that affect the roadmap. Changes like this broke development plans in the past, and that's bad especially if they were communicated and documented for months.
@jesusmmp @mpellicer Agreed. That's why I've put the PR up early, for transparency.

@mpellicer Are there particular commits in the s2u branch that you are worried about? This PR mainly affects the web components, the lit stuff, so I'm hopeful we won't get a lot of overlap. Is there any chance you can prioritise merging the risky commits into master? Can you point me to those commits so I can take a look?

@adrianfish Thanks for the attention.

As far as I can tell there are only two commits, S2U-5 and S2U-34, but this PR modifies more than 600 files so I don't know what side effects will produce in our contributions to Master, the 22.x versions are just fine in that branch since I don't think this work will be ever merged into 22.x

The commits are pretty clean:
https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commits/s2u-22x/webcomponents

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commit/4e3956c97e2ebc46caa88f958a746c944b664a77
https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commit/0d8b791e61a76439f051336c999628ef13cf6fe6

One feature comes from 2020 and suffered from refactors so would be good to have in Master after all, 

If this PR is important for Master, and considering that our features are also important for Master, I'm fine prioritizing both contributions to Master to happen soon.

CC @bgarciaentornos as author of both pieces of work.

Thanks again Adrian

@mpellicer @bgarciaentornos
This PR's getting a bit painful with the conflicts and I'd like to get it in soonish, if possible. So, if we could get any webcomponents PRs into master soon for review, that would be great.

Well @adrianfish, we have very very limited resources to contribute stuff to Master right now, but we made the weekly meeting today and I've assigned @stetsche to contribute the most critical features, with the help of @bgarciaentornos.

We're going to contribute to Master these two tickets very soon:

https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/S2U-34
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/S2U-5

@bgarciaentornos Do you feel that other tickets need contribution? I don't see any here:

https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/commits/s2u-22x/webcomponents

Thanks
You're right, those 2 seem to be the only tickets with related changes (although I'm seeing here other backend changes on tools like assignments but I'm guessing that's because it's still a draft).
Great news, thanks for putting people on this. I know you're on a tight schedule.
Hi @adrianfish,  I can not work on the migration of S2U-5 at the moment because of other tasks. It will take some time until I can get to it, so this PR can go in first, let's not block it further!

@stetsche Great news. I can stop rebasing it now then :)

I'll do a load of testing today and I'll ask you for a review. Obviously, it is a big PR, but if you could just skim over it that would be good.
@stetsche Thanks for the review, btw. Really appreciate it. You spotted some real crap from me :)

@stetsche The ui components are staying in the main Sakai repo for now. It seemed to make sense to just change things gradually. We can get the benefits of a monorepo approach from inside the webcomponents module. We can publish components to the npm repo, all that stuff, but the code still stays together. That may change in the future, but I didn't want to bite too much off at once.
@adrianfish You are welcome, thanks for the info!

Adrian so this will all end up in the sakai-ui repo? and I am guessing this is the a step before that happens? If so I think it would be a good idea to update the webcomponents strategy doc and layout the direction there?

this is very good direction so that we can start publishing webcomponents separately from Sakai, nice!!!

Regarding the package author entries:
https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v10/configuring-npm/package-json#people-fields-author-contributors

It's recommended to supply the email address and the one I've used is attached to a sakai-ui npm repository at https://www.npmjs.com/~sakai-ui. At the moment we are not publishing to it as we are linking between npm modules in our bundling, but we will be at some point.

> Regarding the package author entries:

Maybe we can just use:
```
{
  "name": "...",
  "url": "..."
}
```
> Both email and url are optional either way.

Or possibly sakai-dev list as email?

The problem is that we already have the sakai-ui namespace on npm, and the login is sakai.user.interface@gmail.com. We could use the expanded multiple lines version, but the single line conforms with the way git histories show things.

body:
This proposed PR revises the auto-pinning behavior introduced with [SAK-48809](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48809) such that auto-pinning would behave like the auto-favorites behavior before Trinity, except that auto-favoriting / auto-pinning would be enabled for all users (instead of controlled per user preference before Sakai 23). The test plan in [SAK-48948](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48948) has been revised to clarify distinctive changes to be fixed with this PR.  What's key though and not necessarily clear in the test plan is that this PR: a) auto-pins sites for instructors regardless of the published/unpublished state of the site, and b) honors unpinning events for all users by not re-pinning sites a user has explicitly unpinned.

Accordingly, in order to retain user preferences when a user unfavorites / unpins a site-- while forgoing continued reliance on XML parsing for this-- I’ve transposed the autoFavoritesSeenSites user preference from SAKAI_PREFRENCES.XML to a new boolean HAS_BEEN_UNPINNED added to the PINNED_SITES table. By default this value is set to false and-- with one exception described below--- is only set to true when a user explicitly unpins a site. The user can subsequently re-pin the site, which toggles the value back to false.

When a site is unpinned, its corresponding POSITION value is set to -1 (whereas positive integers signify an actual position in the site navigation). Logic in PinnedSiteRepositoryImpl and PortalServiceImpl has been accordingly revised to distinguish pinned from unpinned records, distinguished primarily by the hasBeenUnpinned field of the PinnedSite class. 

The above change to the database schema assumes that the Quartz job described in [SAK-48700](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48700) (or a subsequent refinement of it, depending on timing) may accommodate the transfer of autoFavoritesSeenSites values to corresponding PINNED_SITES records when migrating user’s favorite sites to pinned sites. A crucial addendum would be to transcribe sites in the Sites drawer (i.e., non-hidden sites) that are not favorites to have records in PINNED_SITES with HAS_BEEN_UNPINNED set to true; this would prevent all such sites from displaying as pinned sites in the site navigation, which could be in the dozens or even hundreds for some instructors.

Finally while working on this PR, I observed a new bug affecting the PortalServiceImpl.update method for the handling of EVENT_SITE_PUBLISH (i.e., site.publish). At some recent point between the release of [SAK-48809](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48809) and now, e.getContext returns null whereas it used to return the siteId-- at least this was so at the time of the release of SAK-48809. (This behavor is evident in trunk on nightly.) Investigating this further, I observe that the null event context seems to be derived from the current placement’s being null (e.g., returned from ToolComponent.getCurrentPlacement). Though I’m not sure why this is now occurring for (only?) publishing events, I’ve adapted the event handling code in PortalServiceImpl.update to check for a null context and to otherwise parse e.getResource to obtain the siteId. The latter proves to be what is allowing publish events to actually create pinned site records for users. This issue is incorporated into the revised [SAK-48948](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48948) test plan.

[SAK-48809]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48809?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ
[SAK-48948]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48948?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ
[SAK-48700]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48700?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

body:
This pull request adds UX features to Date Manager and fixes several open issues. 
Fixed are the following:
From the re-opened [SAK-46023 - Date Manager > Nullable fields for some activities needs to be allowed](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-46023)

- Tests & Quizzes hide feedback date - No error, but no change in the settings. When you reload date manager, these dates re-appear
- Announcements start/end dates - “Uncaught Error” in Date Manager when trying to save after clearing out dates
- Lessons hide until date- “Uncaught Error” in Date Manager when trying to save after clearing out dates

Also fixed:

- [SAK-46212 - Date Manager: unable to change announcement dates if open date set without hide date](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-46212)
- [SAK-48788 - Date Manager: Announcements - Uncaught error (SQL lock) if fixing date from previous error](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48788)
- [SAK-48789 - Date Manager: Calendar - Uncaught error (SQL lock) if fixing date from previous error](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48789)
- Resources affecting Files (not Folders): Uncaught error (SQL lock) if fixing date from previous error

UX Features added to Date Manager:

- Ability to clear any date - required date fields subject to validation upon Save
- Assessible Clear date button 
- Date input field value now shows in title element (helpful for Accessibility and when dates fields compressed due to narrow screen widths (tablets, etc.)

![image](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/50058682/6e03f11c-4a2b-4a8c-9359-85b1fdb85949)
![image](https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/assets/50058682/0cf932b2-0bd5-4360-8d66-fa6288cfe65c)

body:
Jira: [SAK-49006](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49006)

Two issues where causing mails to be received only in English, regardless of the course or user language preferences.

- Only the default mail template was being stored on database. I'm fixing this by putting the default template last.

- `user.getReference()` was being used to get the user locale. It returns _"user/" + internal ID_ instead of just the _internal ID_.
By using `user.getId()` we can make `getRenderedTemplateForUser(...)` work fine.

For the DB changes to get applied,  _email_template_item_ has to be emptied and tomcat restarted.
Or use conversion script: https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai-reference/pull/211


[SAK-49006]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49006?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ
comments: When you apply the script, do you lose all your customizations right? Is the only way to do it?

Jira: [SAK-49006](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49006)

Two issues where causing mails to be received only in English, regardless of the course or user language preferences.

- Only the default mail template was being stored on database. I'm fixing this by putting the default template last.

- `user.getReference()` was being used to get the user locale. It returns _"user/" + internal ID_ instead of just the _internal ID_.
By using `user.getId()` we can make `getRenderedTemplateForUser(...)` work fine.

For the DB changes to get applied,  _email_template_item_ has to be emptied and tomcat restarted.

JIRA: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-49015

The issue arises because we are retrieving the title of the site instead of its Id. 

In course sites created by the Job Scheduler, there is no error since `site.getTitle()` is the same as `site.getId()`. However, in manually created course sites, `site.getTitle()` differs from `site.getId()`.

body:
JIRA: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48622

The issue occurs because ```hasAssociatedRubric()``` only allows people who are rubric creator, editor or evaluator to view the rubric association.

Since this Jira ticket mentions that students are allowed to view rubric in the Discussions tool, I use ```getAssociationForToolAndItem``` to get the associated rubric.
comments: I add the ```hasVisibleAssociatedRubric()``` function to enable students to view the rubric. This function is similar to ```hasAssociatedRubric()```, with the distinction that ```hasVisibleAssociatedRubric()``` allows users with the ```rubric.evaluee``` permission to view the rubric. @ern What do you think?
@zhuoY121 I would make sure that you test all the tools rubrics integrates with, I will also check this out locally and review

body:
Besides restoring the Lessons subpage nav code removed from SAK-48804, this proposed PR repairs UX issues that may not have yet been addressed when adapting the Lessons subpage nav to the new portal, Trinity. 

For a demo of the proposed fix, refer to the screencast, SAK-48907-ProposedFix.mp4, attached to the [corresponding jira](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48907).
comments: I've narrowed down a few dozen Codacy errors down to five, about which I don't know how to proceed-- one of which (the medium one) looks like a false error, and it's based on code that existed prior to SAK-48804.

Responses regarding the wider context of this PR are in the conversation in the corresponding jira. 

The defaults of my emacs editor (and my copying-pasting) were responsible for the odd indentation issues raised by the first commit of this PR. My revision to this PR will restore the prior version of this file, plus one fix to make the brace positions consistent within the class.

Other issues I’ll respond to where they’re raised.
What's the state of this PR? Thanks

I've been maintaining my own local branch of this feature, using the same paradigm as was supported in the past: the Lessons tool server side provides json to the portal, and the portal's client side code parses and renders the subpage navigation.
@hornersa do you have any more updates to this PR?

@ern - My code for this has evolved over time. Per comments in the corresponding jira back in May or so (https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48907), I'm still dealing with several other priorities. It will take me a while to get back to trying to contribute similar code. I defer to you on whether we should close this PR. I surmise it would be easier for me down the road to open a different one, though it would be good to preserve the feedback in this one.
is this your latest and best code addressing this issue?
@ottenhoff - No, this code PR was submitted 13 months ago. As it was not incorporated, I made changes to it over time.
can you point us to your best branch addressing this issue? thanks.

@ottenhoff - Bear in mind that I've solely evolved the code for 23.x. On a temporary, provisional basis, I have pushed the current, in-development copy of Pacific Lutheran University's Sakai 23 code to github here:

https://github.com/hornersa/sakai/tree/23.x-PLU-SHARED-20240802

Github is indexing the code at the time I'm writing this, so searches through the git log in github might not work for a while. That said, after you copy this branch, I recommend searching for the following strings in the commit messages, listed chronologically from latest to earliest:

- SAKAI23-345 (1 commit)
- SAKAI23-324 (4 commits)
- SAK-48907 (1 commit)

I think these commits account for the entirety for the Lessons subpage navigation feature that we have working locally. However, if you observe that there are significant missing pieces, let me know and I'll investigate.

Once you have the code copied, let me know and I'll proceed to remove the branch from my repo.

I hope this helps.

@ern - During our phone conversation I think I may have mis-spoken about the "two sqlRead calls" per Sakai site per page load. Since then I've revisited the pertinent code for SimplePageToolDaoImpl.getLessonSubPageJSON. While the "two sqlRead calls" was a problem at some point, I now think that with one of the "SAKAI23-324" commits I had replaced both calls with logic relying on objects already cached by hibernate. 

That said, it would still make sense to profile the code, especially the extant calls to getLessonSubPageJSON.
Closing this as a new PR will be coming soon.

body: JIRA: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48969 This issue occurs because the ```getGradableForSite()``` endpoint returns all submissions without filtering those that the current user does not have access to. To address this, we need to update the endpoint implementation to filter the submissions based on the access rights of the current user. 1. The ```getSelectedGroupUsers()``` function has been modified to make it ```public``` and the last parameter type has been changed from ```List``` to ```List```. This change ensures consistency across all usages of the function, as all the places where it is used already pass a ```List``` as the last parameter. 2. I use ```assignmentService.allowAddSubmissionUser()``` function to fetch the users who are allowed to submit. These users are the same as those displayed in the "Submissions" page of the Assignment, which is accessed by clicking the "grade" button. (Refer to the screenshot) 3. Add a filter in ```getGradableForSite()``` to ensure that for the current assignment, the current user can only view submitters who are visible to them. 4. Add a filter in ```getSubmitterGroupList()``` to ensure that for the group assignment, the current user can only view groups where they have the grading permission. Individual assignment: Group assignment:

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48818

The basic problem with this issue is that on FF change is only fired when the time fields are populated, so due on the task is never set. Setting the default due to the current epoch millis will populate the datetime-local time fields and hopefully inform the user how to set those fields.

Mozilla has an open ticket about actually showing the time picker alongside the date picker, as Chrome does. *Hopefully*, this will be coming down the pipeline soon.

https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1726108

body:
https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48697

I've reduced the size of the json downloaded by ~5 times, and I've removed an unnecessary fetch to load the grades. So, 5 times less data, and half the http connections when grading. I've added a data loading screen so the user knows what's going on. Also, I've added paging so we can handle large class sizes. On the first load, only the skeletons of the submissions are fetched, apart from the selected submission, which is hydrated together with one either side of it. As the user navigates using the next and previous buttons, the code looks ahead and hydrates the next two unhydrated submissions.

body:
This may still get some more updates. There's 9 plugins that could be fixed on this.

* 2 of them are our plugins that we'll need to update `org.sakaiproject.maven.plugins:sakai:1.4.5`,`org.sakaiproject.maven.plugins:webjars-maven-plugin:1.0`
* 1 of them has a new version but the config changed: `org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-antrun-plugin:1.3`
* 1 of them is an old version of handlebars that probably could get upgraded: `com.github.jknack:handlebars-maven-plugin:1.3.2`
* 1 of them is also older handlebars but the webjars diverged and some work is needed to resolve here `com.github.jknack:handlebars-maven-plugin:4.0.6`, 
* 1 will likely eventually get upgraded but hasn't yet: `org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-war-plugin:3.3.2`
* 3 will likely never see upgrades so will need local updates or alternatives: `com.coderplus.maven.plugins:copy-rename-maven-plugin:1.0`, `org.apache.pluto:maven-pluto-plugin:1.1.7`, `com.github.eirslett:frontend-maven-plugin:1.12.1`

Feel free to fix anything here and add to this PR or we can merge this and address whatever is left afterward. 

I'll probably at least try to fix the antrun issue as that's the easiest left. The handlebars issues aren't fixed and kind of a mess, especially the one project still on handlebars1, and we have a dependencies that were the same versions between org.webjars and com.github.jknack but not anymore so probably will need to be redone as `dependencyManagement`. 

And can try to remember how to update our sakaiproject plugins and maybe get help from @ern on the release of those. 

This is working now, I had to hold handlebars back because the latest version wasn't working currently under Java 11, there's an issue there for that. But that is on that list.
comments:
Earle suggested to test on old versions, I can test that. These changes are mostly for future Maven 4 support.

The enforcer plugin has 3.1.1 as the minimum @bjones86 said Ubuntu is shipping with 3.6.3. If we have to update the minimum version that's fine but we should find if there is a minimum that changes.

3.1.1 was released on 2013-10-04 and is long EOL. There is no Docker image so it's hard to test my build workflow back that far. 

[The README](https://maven.apache.org/docs/history.html) says "Maven before 3.6.3 has now reached its end of life." and even 3.6.3 is almost 4 years old.

The earliest I could _easily_ go back to test this with was Maven 3.8.2+Temurin 11 which was released on 2021-08-01 and that compiled no problems with these changes. 

I also tested with 3.6.3 + OpenJDK 11 and that also compiled fine.

It looks like this is good to go but we may want to bump our minimal Maven version here up to a minimal of 3.6.3. The page says plugin compatibility goes back to 3.2.5, so that seems like it would be the most minimal but I haven't tested it as there's only a JDK 8 package with that.

I’ve attached screenshots of Assignments, Announcements, Resources, and Tests & Quizzes where my proposed fix restores a magnifying glass icon for the filter part of bootstrap-multiselect. 

With this proposed fix, I am overriding the default ‘filter’ parameter not only out of expedience. It seems like the class ‘fas’ found in the default for bootstrap-multiselect (since 0.9.16) is intentional; that ‘fas’ class is also used elsewhere in bootstrap-multiselect.js. We instead need an “fa” class for the magnifying icon to display.

I think that this kind of thing wouldn't happen if the JPA Metamodel API was used. I just learned about it today, but in my local testing it seems like you just have to add a dependency on "hibernate-jpamodelgen" in your pom.xml and then you can do things like

`agr.get(AssignmentGradeRecord_.studentId)`

and have it checked at compile time.

@ern is this an option for Sakai?

body: This implementation is using the Interface HardDeleteAware. Only data which concerns the tool is considered.
comments:
This PR is related to PR  SAK-48874 Assignments support removal of data when site is hard deleted #11547 
[https://github.com/sakaiproject/sakai/pull/11547](url)

Hi @jkjanetschek, I looked this over and will add the missing bits to the other PR.

One thing I noticed while looking at this, is interfaces like HardDeleteAware are not designed and implemented properly. 
The design is that the entity (object) broker system should be responsible for calling notifying it's entities that something is occurring and action should be taken by the affected entities, in this case a site is being removed so the related entities should be removed.  However It should be the responsibility of the EntityManager to initiate the appropriate action (_EntityManager would need to be informed that such an action is happening likely by the SiteRemovalAdvisor_).

So in the end a few adjustments will be needed to properly reflect this chain of command.

Thank you for pointing this out!

body:
JIRA: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48482

After investigating the codebase, I found that the missing URL issue was caused by a backend issue. Specifically, when the user edits the information of the task, use the PUT request to update the data through ```updateTask()```. However, unlike ```getTasks()``` which correctly sets the URL, ```updateTask()``` does not, leading to the missing URL problem.

I extracted some of codes in ```getTasks()``` and created a new function that handles the same logic used in ```getTasks()``` and ```updateTasks()```. This function is designed to ensure that all necessary information, including the URL, is properly updated when a user edits a task's details. By doing so, we were able to resolve the issue of missing URLs that occurred when using the ```updateTasks()``` function.

comments:
I'm not seeing any error loading bootstrap from the console logs, and we use the function `includeWebjarLibrary("bootstrap");` so we don't have to update code all over the place when we do a version upgrade for a library. 

In the logs it says
"Adding webjar library bootstrap, version 3.3.7"

Did this fix it for you? Maybe the fix is just removing this line entirely rather than replacing it. I don't know why it would need bootstrap in this module and it looks like including the default bootstrap styles (scaffolding.less) which has a color of `#333` is what's messing this up?

It looks like qtip2 and bootstrap were included in the commit prior 0de533cbd24f3682bf0aed7b1a1f13452bb88ab7 in SAK-47188. I'd think that only qtip2 might be needed here.

Hi Matt, replacing ```<script>includeWebjarLibrary("bootstrap");</script>``` with ```<script src="/library/webjars/bootstrap/3.3.7/js/bootstrap.min.js<h:outputText value="#{delivery.CDNQuery}" />"></script>``` fixes both this issue and [SAK-47188](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47188).

Although removing ```<script>includeWebjarLibrary("bootstrap");</script>``` can fix this issue on 22.x, the issue in SAK-47188 still occurs (there is a console error in Lessons tool)

```
Uncaught TypeError: $(...).popover is not a function
    at HTMLInputElement.<anonymous> (finInputValidator.js:46:15)
    at HTMLInputElement.dispatch (jquery.js:5226:27)
    at r.handle (jquery.js:4878:28)
``` 


[SAK-47188]: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-47188?atlOrigin=eyJpIjoiNWRkNTljNzYxNjVmNDY3MDlhMDU5Y2ZhYzA5YTRkZjUiLCJwIjoiZ2l0aHViLWNvbS1KU1cifQ

body:
This required a lot of research and trial/error but the end result actually seemed came out to be pretty simple. 

It actually comes out to be about 300KB/second rather than 1MB/second so maybe the default should be 1/2 or even 1/3 the duration. I doubt anyone is going to increase this much beyond the max and maybe we don't even need another setting. I was thinking of just setting it to `getNamePronunciationDuration()/2` MB. 

What do you think?

I reworked it from the original commit and removed the specific configuration and just set it to be 500KB/sec.

body: Refer to the screencast, SAK-48515-ProposedFixDemo.mp4, which is attached to the jira: https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48515
comments: After creating the PR, I observe a problem of button alignment in the student view. I'll try to work on that tomorrow (Friday) and force push a revision when done.
The fix was easier than I anticipated. I attached another screencast to the jira (SAK-48515-ProposedFixDemo_StudentView.mp4) to show what the student view looks like with this proposed fix.

I really don't like the idea of moving back to the tabs, I have to say. Can we not just add those three buttons to the same button row, so it wraps with the rest of them? You could use similar logic to just remove the text labels from the buttons as the screen shrinks, and it would all just wrap. I don't know how hard this would be without trying it myself, but it seems to make sense to just link those two bars together in some way so we don't have to return to the horrendous tabs :) Maybe I'm asking the impossible, if so, just say so.
@adrianfish - I'm returning to work today after being away for a week. I'll try to implement your suggestions within the next few weeks or so.

@adrianfish  - This revised PR incorporates your suggestion to get rid of the tabs, etc. In [SAK-48515](https://sakaiproject.atlassian.net/browse/SAK-48515), I attached a new screencast, SAK-48515-RevisedProposedFixDemo.mp4.

body:
Bumps [spring-core](https://github.com/spring-projects/spring-framework) from 5.3.26 to 5.3.27.
Release notes

Sourced from spring-core's releases.

v5.3.27

:star: New Features

  • Limit string concatenation in SpEL expressions #30331
  • Limit SpEL expression length #30329
  • Disable variable assignment in SimpleEvaluationContext #30327
  • Introduce StringUtils.truncate() #30291
  • Introduce ObjectUtils.nullSafeConciseToString() #30287
  • Make HttpComponentsHeadersAdapter#getFirst nullable #30269

:lady_beetle: Bug Fixes

  • Fix regression in ReactorServerHttpRequest related to IPV6 Zone id with "%" #30314
  • SSE breaks with indenting serializer in WebMvc.fn #30302
  • Increase max regex length in SpEL expressions #30298
  • NullPointerException on timeout in HttpComponentsClientHttpConnector when using Apache HttpComponents #30246
  • Wrong MockRestRequestMatchers.header() method in spring-test being invoked (JDK issue?) #30235
  • TypeNotPresentException: org/springframework/cglib/proxy/NoOp not present on Java 17 #30228
  • Refine generic type management in AbstractMessageWriterResultHandler #30215
  • MvcUriComponentsBuilder.fromMethodCall breaks for controller with CharSequence return type #30212
  • Handle all exceptions for stored proc output param retrieval in SharedEntityManagerCreator #30164

:notebook_with_decorative_cover: Documentation

  • Fix @PathVariable reference documentation code snippets #30258
  • Fix example in Javadoc for @EnableWebSocket #30187
  • Fix anchor in link to "Web on Reactive Stack" chapter #30163

:hammer: Dependency Upgrades

  • Upgrade to Reactor 2020.0.31 #30315

body:
The proposed solution resolves two distinct bugs:

The first fix in AssignmentToolUtils prevents calls to gradingService.setAssignmentScoreComment which throw IllegalArgumentExceptions for blank comments.

The second fix conditionally reroutes assignmentName values which-- instead of being the titles of gradebook items-- are now the IDs, at least for Sakai 23 & 24. Note however that prior to Sakai 23 & 24, the associations between assignments and gradebook items that originate from Gradebook are still based on gradebook item titles. This second fix assumes that continuity with those associations will still be upheld (without necessarily provisioning a one-time Quartz job to homogenize all such associations to be based on gradebook item ID).
